1093.title: Film show: Monkey avatar tells Robbie Williams' story in 'Better Man'
1093.summary: Film critic Emma Jones tells us why the CGI chimp who stands in for Robbie Williams does a good job at conveying the British pop star's fundamental loneliness in the quirky biopic "Better Man". We also discuss Mel Gibson’s latest stint behind the camera in "Flight Risk", as Mark Wahlberg and Michelle Dockery provide some old-fashioned comic relief in this cockpit-set caper. Meanwhile, French film "The Quiet Son" sees Vincent Lindon put in an award-winning performance as the single father of two young men, as filmmakers Delphine and Muriel Coulin explore the socio-economic reality in the east of France. Plus we check out a new take on the life of German anti-Nazi theologian Dietrich Bonhoeffer.

She also discusses examples of art and resistance throughout history, which she gathered while researching her book.

1111.summary: Police identified the suspect as an Afghan man. Politicians gearing up for an election responded with comments about migration and law and order.

1112.title: Afghan refugees feel abandoned after Trump executive order halts flights
1112.summary: The fate of tens of thousands of Afghans awaiting resettlement in the U.S. hangs in the balance after Trump suspended the refugee admissions program.
1112.author: Rick Noack, Haq Nawaz Khan, Abigail Hauslohner

1113.title: Prince Harry settles with Murdoch’s U.K. tabloids, gets long-sought apology
1113.summary: News Group Newspapers offered a “full and unequivocal apology” to Harry for the “serious intrusion” into his private life by the Sun between 1996 and 2011.
1113.author: Karla Adam, William Booth

1114.title: At U.S.-Canada border, anxieties on both sides as Trump takes office
1114.summary: In Manitoba, along the longest undefended border in the world, Canadians push back against Trump’s allegations of an “invasion” of migrants and drugs.
1114.author: Amanda Coletta

1115.title: What is birthright citizenship, and which countries have it?
1115.summary: President Donald Trump has falsely claimed the U.S. is alone in offering citizenship as a birthright. More than 30 countries do — but some have rolled it back.
1115.author: Vivian Ho

1116.title: A new age of global competition rises in Trump’s shadow
1116.summary: The dichotomy between the gatherings of rich and powerful at Donald Trump’s inauguration and at the World Economic Forum in Davos was stark as the world woke up to a new reality under Trump.
1116.author: Ishaan Tharoor

1117.title: Gaza ceasefire holds, Israel launches raid on Jenin in West Bank
1117.summary: The Israeli military launched a large raid in the city of Jenin in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday, killing nine people and injuring 40 others, according to Palestinian health officials.
1117.author: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Abbie Cheeseman, Shira Rubin, Sammy Westfall

1118.title: Trump’s ambassador nominee questions U.S. funding of ‘antisemitic’ U.N.
1118.author: Karen DeYoung, Missy Ryan

1119.title: Google rushed to sell AI tools to Israel’s military after Hamas attack
1119.author: Gerrit De Vynck

1120.title: Valérie André, first woman to fly helicopter rescue missions in combat, dies at 102
1120.summary: The French army neurosurgeon and pilot known as “Mademoiselle Helicopter" flew more than 160 wounded men from the battlefields of Indochina to hospitals in Hanoi.
1120.author: Phil Davison

1121.title: Violence erupts in West Bank as settlers attack, Israel raids Jenin
1121.summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the assault on Jenin would be “extensive and significant,” as the military erected new checkpoints across the West Bank.
1121.author: Claire Parker, Heidi Levine, Miriam Berger, Abbie Cheeseman

1122.title: Israeli military chief to resign as tensions rise between Netanyahu, army brass
1122.author: Shira Rubin, Gerry Shih

1123.title: Hotel fire at popular Turkish ski resort kills 76 and injures dozens
1123.summary: The fire in Turkey’s Kartalkaya area started on the restaurant floor of the Grand Kartal Hotel, authorities said.
1123.author: Beril Eski

1124.title: Israeli military chief to resign as tensions rise between Netanyahu, army brass
1124.summary: Lt. Gen. Herzi Halevi said he plans to resign in March, in the highest-level departure to date of a military or security official over the Hamas-led attacks in 2023.
1124.author: Shira Rubin, Gerry Shih

1125.title: In Milei’s Argentina, Trump sees a road map. What does it show?
1125.summary: Javier Milei, Argentina’s chainsaw-wielding president, has won Donald Trump’s praise and attended his inauguration. Under Milei, inflation is down, but poverty is up.
1125.author: Bryan Pietsch, David Feliba

1126.title: 80 killed in Colombia’s deadliest wave of violence since peace accords
1126.summary: The unusually deadly violence delivers a devastating blow to the “total peace” program of the country’s first leftist president, Gustavo Petro.
1126.author: Samantha Schmidt

1127.title: Qatar confident Gaza ceasefire will last, but says next stage of talks is complex
1127.author: Susannah George

1128.title: Americans freed in Afghanistan-U.S. prisoner swap, Taliban says
1128.summary: Americans Ryan Corbett and William W. McKenty III were freed, their families said. The Taliban said Khan Mohammed, an Afghan serving a life sentence in California, was released.
1128.author: Victoria Bisset

1129.title: Settler attacks rage across West Bank after ceasefire starts, Trump lifts sanctions
1129.author: Miriam Berger, Abbie Cheeseman

1130.title: Israeli raid on Jenin kills 9, injures 40
1130.author: Abbie Cheeseman, Claire Parker, Bryan Pietsch

1131.title: What to know about the WHO and its rocky relationship with the U.S.
1131.summary: Trump had started the process of leaving the World Health Organization in his first term but was not able to complete it.
1131.author: Annabelle Timsit, Ruby Mellen

1132.title: Trump designated drug cartels as terrorists. Here’s what that means.
1132.summary: Cartels have set off car bombs and beheaded victims. But designating them as terrorist groups could have unforeseen consequences.
1132.author: Mary Beth Sheridan

1133.title: Prince Harry trial takes on Rupert Murdoch’s U.K. tabloids. What to know.
1133.summary: Prince Harry’s civil lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch’s News Group Newspapers is scheduled to begin this week.
1133.author: Karla Adam

1134.title: Israelis look past euphoria and urge Trump to follow up on hostage deal
1134.author: Shira Rubin

1135.title: Trump lifts sanctions on Israeli settlers accused of violence
1135.author: Kelly Kasulis Cho

1136.title: Mittens the cat becomes frequent flyer after being overlooked in cargo hold
1136.summary: Mittens made the 7.5-hour flight between New Zealand and Australia three times in 24 hours.
1136.author: Michelle Butterfield

1137.title: Trump admin cancels travel for refugees already cleared to settle in U.S.
1137.summary: Among those affected are the more than 1,600 Afghans cleared to resettle in the U.S. as part of the program that the Biden administration set up.
1137.author: Globalnews Digital

1138.title: ‘Mr. Trump, f— off’: Danish politician lashes out over Greenland proposal
1138.summary: "Dear President Trump, listen very carefully. Greenland has been part of the Danish kingdom for 800 years," Anders Vistisen said.
1138.author: Katie Scott

1139.title: Prince Harry gets apology, big settlement from Murdoch’s UK tabloids over intrusion
1139.summary: Prince Harry blames the media for the death of his mother, Princess Diana. He also blames them for the persistent attacks on his wife, Meghan Markle.
1139.author: Globalnews Digital

1140.title: Trump orders U.S. out of World Health Organization
1140.summary: The move sets a 12-month notice period for the U.S. to leave the United Nations health agency and stop all financial contributions to its work.
1140.author: Globalnews Digital

1141.title: Marburg disease: Sample from remote Tanzanian region tests positive
1141.summary: This is the second outbreak of Marburg in Kagera since 2023.
1141.author: Globalnews Digital

1142.title: Dozens dead after raging night fire at ski hotel in Turkey
1142.summary: The fire occurred near the start of a two-week winter break for schools, when hotels in the region are packed.
1142.author: Globalnews Digital

1143.title: ‘Unreal’: Family living in B.C. loses home in devastating Ukraine bomb blast
1143.summary: It is believed a Russian bomb targeting a hospital in Zaporizhzhia incinerated several homes in Zlatorov's old neighbourhood, killing a 17-year-old boy.
1143.author: Darya Zargar

1144.title: Three hostages arrive in Israel from Gaza as fragile ceasefire passes first hurdle
1144.summary: The first three hostages released from Gaza have arrived in Israel, the military announced Sunday, hours after the fragile ceasefire between Israel and Hamas took hold. Their mothers were waiting to meet them. Footage showed the three women walking to Red Cross vehicles in Gaza City, surrounded by a crowd that swelled into the thousands...
1144.author: Sawyer Bogdan

1145.title: Middle East latest: A long-awaited Gaza ceasefire starts after a delay
1145.summary: A ceasefire in the Gaza Strip took effect on Sunday following an almost three-hour delay after Hamas was late to name the three hostage it plans to release.
1145.author: Sawyer Bogdan

1146.title: Mongolia’s Prime Minister Talks Becoming a Uranium Producer, Gladhanding Putin, and Navigating Trump 2.0
1146.summary: Oyun-Erdene Luvsannamsrai talks becoming a uranium producer, gladhanding Putin, and navigating Trump 2.0.
1146.author: Charlie Campbell

1147.title: Australia Investigates if Foreign Actors Were Behind Recent String of Antisemitic Attacks
1147.summary: Detectives in Australia are investigating whether foreign actors paying criminals are behind the recent string of antisemitic attacks.
1147.author: Rod McGuirk / AP

1148.title: Israel’s Top General Resigns, Citing Oct. 7 Security Failures
1148.summary: Lt. Gen. Herzi Halevi is the most senior Israeli figure to quit to date over the security breakdown related to Hamas' surprise attack.
1148.author: Associated Press

1149.title: Trump Suspends U.S. Foreign Aid for 90 Days Pending Reviews
1149.summary: The reviews are aimed at determining whether foreign assistance programs are aligned with the President's policy goals.
1149.author: Matthew Lee / AP

1150.title: Sequel to Prince Harry’s Feud With British Tabloids Begins in High-Stakes Trial
1150.summary: The high-stakes trial pitting the Duke of Sussex against Rupert Murdoch's newspapers could cost him millions—even if he wins.
1150.author: Brian Melley / AP

1151.title: Is China Really Powerless to Stop the ‘Scamdemic’? The Truth Is More Complex
1151.author: Charlie Campbell

1152.title: Taliban Releases Two Americans in Prisoner Exchange
1152.summary: Two U.S. citizens—one of whom has been identified as Ryan Corbett—were exchanged for Khan Mohammed, who was convicted by the U.S. of narcotics and terrorism charges.
1152.author: Associated Press

1153.title: Trump Claimed Americans ‘Split the Atom’—New Zealanders Would Like to Have a Word
1153.summary: In his Inaugural Address, Trump credited Americans with splitting the atom, an achievement credited by many to pioneering physicist Ernest Rutherford of New Zealand.
1153.author: Charlotte Graham-McLay / AP

1154.title: The Biggest Moments from the 2025 TIME100 Dinner in Davos
1154.summary: Dario Amodei, CEO and co-founder of AI company Anthropic, joined TIME editor-in-chief Sam Jacobs on stage to talk about the future of AI.
1154.author: Ayesha Javed

1155.title: China’s Vice President Meets With Elon Musk and J.D. Vance Ahead of Trump Inauguration
1155.summary: Han Zheng, Chinese President Xi Jinping’s envoy at Trump’s Inauguration, discussed fentanyl, trade, and technology with Vance and Musk.
1155.author: Associated Press

1156.title: The waiting stinks, but Sydney may soon enjoy the aroma of its 'corpse flower'
1156.summary: The flower's Latin name translates as "giant, misshapen penis." But it's better known to locals as "Putricia." Royal Botanical Garden Sydney has even set up a livestream in anticipation.
1156.author: Scott Neuman

1157.title: Trump threatens Russia with tariffs and sanctions if it does not agree to end war
1157.summary: It is unclear how much impact economic penalties would have on the Russian government, since they already face various sanctions imposed by the previous administration.
1157.author: Franco Ordoñez

1158.title: Another casualty of Israel's war in Lebanon: Efforts to save endangered turtles
1158.summary: Lebanese volunteers are anxious to get back to sea turtle conservation on southern beaches that were off-limits to civilians when fighting escalated between Israel and Hezbollah.
1158.author: Jane Arraf

1159.title: Prince Harry settles with Murdoch's British tabloids as trial is about to begin
1159.summary: Prince Harry has agreed to settle his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's British tabloids. The deal ends a years' long battle to hold the newspapers accountable for invasions of privacy.
1159.author: David Folkenflik

1160.title: Russian attack drones are killing civilians for target practice, Ukraine says
1160.summary: Russia appears to be using drone attacks on civilians to train young pilots, says a Ukrainian lawmaker with ties to Ukraine's military. One city has been hit by hundreds of drone strikes this year.
1160.author: Brian Mann

1161.title: Rebuilding Gaza will be a massive project. Here are 5 things to know
1161.summary: After more than 15 months of relentless Israeli bombardment, Gaza has been left in ruins. If last week's ceasefire holds, rebuilding could take decades, cost tens of billions of dollars and present overwhelming obstacles.
1161.author: Scott Neuman

1162.title: Harvard agrees to adopt a broad definition of antisemitism to settle two lawsuits
1162.summary: Several other schools have recently settled similar lawsuits, and suits are pending against others, including the University of Pennsylvania and Columbia University.
1162.author: Tovia Smith

1163.title: Breaking down the executive actions Trump is using to govern
1163.summary:
President Donald J. Trump began taking decisive steps to implement his agenda hours after being sworn in.

In the day since he's once again become President, Trump has signed more than 200 executive actions aimed at delivering on campaign promises such as lower energy prices, mass deportations and an end to birthright citizenship.

There's been a deluge of actions, orders and pronouncements during the President's first day. From tariffs to immigration to the January 6th pardons – we breakdown everything down.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

1164.title: Palestinians Return to Their Homes in Gaza
1164.summary:
A fragile ceasefire has been in place in Gaza since Sunday, bringing an end to the fighting between Israel and Hamas at least temporarily. Some Palestinians are feeling safe enough to return to homes they fled during the way. Our producer in Gaza returns to the southern city of Rafah, the site of an intense bombing campaign. There, many are returning to their homes to find utter destruction.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
1164.author: Anas Baba

1165.title: At least 66 people killed in a fire at a ski resort in northwest Turkey
1165.summary: A fire raged through a popular ski resort south of Istanbul early Tuesday. The deadly fire broke out during a school holiday when the area's hotels are packed.
1165.author: The Associated Press

1166.title: Colombian president visits southern Haiti as country battles surge in gang violence

1167.title: Aid pours into Gaza as ceasefire enters fourth day

1168.title: Italy releases Libyan wanted for alleged war crimes

1169.title: Spain's Sabadell bank to move HQ back to Catalonia

1170.title: NEV development in China: a review of 2024 and expectations for 2025

1171.title: Greek police investigating ancient statue found in bag near trash cans
1171.summary: Police in Greece are investigating the discovery of a 2,000-year-old statue in a black bag near some trash cans in a suburban municipality in the Thessaloniki region on Saturday.
1171.author: Brad Matthews

1172.title: Former El Salvador President Mauricio Funes dies in exile in Nicaragua at age 65
1172.summary: Former El Salvador President Mauricio Funes, who spent the final years of his life in Nicaragua to avoid various criminal sentences, died late Tuesday. He was 65.
1172.author: Marcos Alemán

1173.title: A 2,000-year-old statue is found abandoned in a garbage bag in Greece
1173.summary: A marble statue of a woman believed to be more than 2,000 years old was found abandoned in a garbage bag near the Greek city of Thessaloniki, police said Wednesday.
1173.author: Costas Kantouris

1174.title: Trump to Putin: End Ukraine war or face penalties
1174.summary: President Trump told Russia on Wednesday it needs to strike a deal to end its war with Ukraine or get hit with harsher sanctions and other penalties.
1174.author: Tom Howell Jr.

1175.title: 2 people were killed in a knife attack in Germany and a suspect has been detained, police say
1175.summary: Two people, including a two-year-old boy, were killed and two others were severely injured in a stabbing attack in Bavaria on Wednesday, German police said.

1176.title: China refutes Trump's claim it's operating Panama Canal
1176.summary: China on Wednesday said Panama's sovereignty over the canal linking the Pacific and Atlantic oceans is "not negotiable" as President Trump vows to retake the waterway.
1176.author: Tom Howell Jr.

1177.title: Ukraine to provide combat units with $60 million a month for drones
1177.summary: Ukrainian military ground units will receive $60 million in monthly funding to purchase combat drones, the Ukraine Ministry of Defense announced Tuesday.
1177.author: Vaughn Cockayne

1178.title: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon on tariffs: 'I mean, get over it'
1178.summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon said Wednesday that increased costs from looming tariffs could be worth it if they protect national security.
1178.author: Tom Howell Jr.

1179.title: Coast Guard to surge forces to the border as part of Trump crackdown on illegal immigration
1179.summary: The acting commandant of the Coast Guard has ordered operational commanders to surge forces to the southern border immediately as part of the Trump administration's crackdown on illegal immigration.
1179.author: Mike Glenn

1180.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels release crew of commercial vessel seized in Red Sea in November 2023
1180.summary: Yemen's Houthi rebels said Wednesday they released the crew of the Galaxy Leader, a vehicle carrier seized in November 2023 at the start of their attacks on shipping in the Red Sea corridor over the Israel-Hamas war.
1180.author: Jon Gambrell

1181.title: Long forgotten, Black South African servicemen who died in WWI are finally honored with a memorial
1181.summary: The names are carved on poles of African hardwood that are set upright as if reaching for the sun. No one knows where the men they represent were buried.
1181.author: Gerald Imray

1182.title: Italy government under fire for releasing Libyan warlord accused of war crimes
1182.summary: Italian opposition lawmakers and human rights groups voiced outrage Wednesday after Italy released a Libyan warlord on a technicality, after he was arrested on a warrant from the International Criminal Court accusing him of war crimes and crimes against humanity.
1182.author: Nicole Winfield, Sam Magdy

1183.title: Davos 2025: Trade, tariffs, AI and U.N. chief Guterres dominate World Economic Forum agenda
1183.summary: The U.N. chief ratcheted up his warning about climate change and said the world's thirst for fossil fuels is a "Frankenstein monster" that spares no one, while calling for greater attention to risks posed by artificial intelligence if its ascent goes ungoverned.
1183.author: Jamey Keaten

1184.title: South Korean lawmaker seeks Trump's support for democracy amid political crisis in Seoul
1184.summary: A key member of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's political party was in Washington this week calling on President Trump to express support for freedom and democracy in Northeast Asia at a moment when China and North Korea may seek to take advantage of the political crisis gripping Seoul.
1184.author: Guy Taylor

1185.title: British tabloid admits to decades of spying on Prince Harry in landmark settlement
1185.summary: Prince Harry claimed a monumental victory Wednesday as Rupert Murdoch's U.K. tabloids made an unprecedented apology for intruding in his life over decades and agreed to pay substantial damages to settle his privacy invasion lawsuit.
1185.author: Brian Melley, Jill Lawless

1186.title: Witnesses at a Turkish ski resort stood helpless as people leaped out of a burning hotel
1186.summary: As flames tore through a 12-story hotel at a popular ski resort in northwestern Turkey, friends Esra Karakisa and Halime Cetin stood helpless, paralyzed by the horror unfolding before them: people leaning out of smoke-filled rooms pleading for help and others making the harrowing decision to leap out.
1186.author: Mehmet Guzel

1187.title: Afghans fleeing Taliban urge Trump to lift refugee program suspension
1187.summary: Afghans who fled after the Taliban seized power appealed Wednesday to President Donald Trump to exempt them from an order suspending the relocation of refugees to the United States, some saying they risked their lives to support U.S. troops.
1187.author: Munir Ahmed

1188.title: 'Terror threat to America is alive and persistent': New House GOP report warns of jihadist danger
1188.summary: America's national security defenses are in a "state of disrepair" and the rapid rise in extremist cases across the country underscores the vulnerabilities of the U.S. homeland, key House Republicans warned in a major new report.
1188.author: Ben Wolfgang

1189.title: Pentagon swears in 32 new Trump appointees for top defense posts
1189.summary: The Pentagon inducted 32 new Trump administration appointees for key defense positions, including many aides formerly working for national security committees on Capitol Hill or veterans of the previous Trump administration.
1189.author: Bill Gertz

1190.title: Trump blocks clearances for 51 ex-intelligence officials who questioned Biden laptop story
1190.summary: President Trump issued 46 executive orders on his first day in office targeting national security issues, including the removal of any security clearances held by 51 former intelligence officials linked to election interference in the 2020 presidential campaign.
1190.author: Bill Gertz

1191.title: Fresh fire erupts in Southern California prompting new evacuation orders
1191.summary: The Hughes fire broke out near the Lake Castaic area of northern Los Angeles County, two weeks after blazes that claimed at least 28 lives and devastated the city broke out.
1191.author: Christopher Weber

1192.title: At least two killed in Nashville school shooting
1192.summary: In the United States a teenage girl is dead and at least one other student has been injured during a school shooting in Nashville.

1193.title: Trump presidency LIVE updates: Elon Musk questions Trump’s first tech announcement; Pentagon sends troops to US-Mexico border
1193.summary: Trump’s first week in office is barrelling on and his close advisor, billionaire Elon Musk, has already broken with the White House to question Trump’s first big tech announcement.
1193.author: Sherryn Groch

1194.title: Trump signals tougher approach with Putin on Ukraine
1194.summary: “We can do it the easy way, or the hard way,” said Trump, who previously claimed he would end the war within 24 hours of being sworn in as president.
1194.author: Rob Harris

1195.title: Trump warns Putin to end Ukraine war or face further sanctions
1195.summary: Donald Trump urges Vladimir Putin to negotiate on ending Ukraine war.

1196.title: Prince Harry wins lawsuit against UK tabloid publisher
1196.summary: Prince Harry has claimed a major legal victory against Rupert Murdoch's UK tabloids.

1197.title: Four wounded in Tel Aviv stabbing attack
1197.summary: An attack classified by Israel as a terrorist act has unfolded during a 9News live radio report.

1198.title: Murdoch’s British tabloids offer rare apology in legal settlement with Prince Harry
1198.summary: The Murdoch-owned tabloids offered a “full and unequivocal apology to the Duke of Sussex” for years of serious intrusion into his private life.
1198.author: Brian Melley

1199.title: Uncertainty, trepidation and lawsuits grow as Trump unleashes ‘shock and awe’
1199.summary: Donald Trump’s pardon of almost all convicted January 6 rioters sparked outrage from lawmakers and police, and made some Republicans uncomfortable.
1199.author: Farrah Tomazin, Michael Koziol

1200.title: My family had to bury a relative in their courtyard. Their exhaustion is palpable
1200.summary: According to my cousins, uncles and aunts on the ground, the devastation of Gaza is so complete, so personal, that words and images fail to convey its depth.
1200.author: Ramia Abdo-Sultan

1201.title: Penny Wong visits new Trump administration
1201.summary: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has sat down with Donald Trump’s new security advisor and Marco Rubio, the first cabinet member to be sworn in.

1202.title: Jubilation outside jails as Trump fans give rioters a hero’s welcome
1202.summary: The president calls them hostages. For the Trump faithful camped outside a Washington prison, the Capitol rioters are more like heroes. And now they are free.
1202.author: Michael Koziol

1203.title: Putin and Xi pick up the phone to talk close ties after Trump’s return
1203.summary: In the 1.5-hour video call, the leaders discussed the need to “cope with the uncertainty of the external environment”.
1203.author: Vladimir Isachenkov

1204.title: Trump’s migrant deportations start as bishop pleads with him to have mercy
1204.summary: Bishop Mariann Budde led a service on Trump’s second day in office and told him people feared his executive order. He said her sermon was “not too exciting”.
1204.author: Farrah Tomazin

1205.title: Trump presidency LIVE updates: US president announces $800b AI partnership, continues flurry of announcements; Elon Musk denies performing Nazi salute
1205.summary: Trump is expected to continue to build on his barrage of Inauguration Day announcements, with the White House promising a “massive announcement” on infrastructure.
1205.author: Jessica McSweeney

1206.title: 'Mr Trump, f--- off', says Danish politician
1206.summary: Danish member of the European Parliament Anders Vistisen has delivered a concise but profane message to Donald Trump.

1207.title: Israel embarks on ‘significant ongoing campaign’ in West Bank, killing at least nine Palestinians
1207.summary: The raid occurred as it was announced Israel’s top general had resigned, taking responsibility for security failures tied to Hamas’ attack that triggered the Gaza war.
1207.author: James Mackenzie, Ali Sawafta

1208.title: Melania and Barron Trump now embrace limelight they once avoided
1208.summary: The returning first lady and Barron Trump, the son she had once shielded from the public eye, used the inauguration to reintroduce themselves.
1208.author: Katie Rogers

1209.title: Stabbing attack in Tel Aviv
1209.summary: Streets are in lockdown in Tel Aviv, Israel, after an apparent stabbing attack in the city.

1210.title: Dozens dead and injured in a hotel fire at Turkey ski resort
1210.summary: A fire raged through a 12-storey hotel at a popular resort in northwestern Turkey during a school holiday, killing at least 76 people, officials said.
1210.author: Suzan Fraser

1211.title: Footage shows Palestinian family in car under attack in West Bank during Israeli raid
1211.summary: A series of videos show the moment a car carrying a family in the occupied West Bank came under attack during an Israeli raid into the city of Jenin yesterday.

1212.title: Royal Navy attack submarine warned off Russian spy ship from UK waters
1212.summary: A Royal Navy attack submarine surfaced close to a Russian spy ship off the UK coast in an extraordinary warning to stop spying on British undersea cables, the defence secretary has revealed.

1213.title: Ireland delays selection of prime minister as parliament erupts in row
1213.summary: Ireland has delayed choosing its new prime minister after a row over speaking rights sparked angry scenes in parliament.

1214.title: Why did Trump call Washington bishop 'nasty'?
1214.summary: Donald Trump has hit out at the bishop of Washington after she lectured him on respecting immigrants and LGBT+ citizens during a televised church service.

1215.title: President Trump: 'Peacemaker'?
1215.summary: 👉Listen to The World With Richard Engel And Yalda Hakim on your podcast app👈

1216.title: Hotel fire at ski resort in Turkey kills at least 76 people - four arrested
1216.summary: A fire at a hotel in a popular ski resort in Turkey has killed at least 76 people, the country's interior minister has said.

1217.title: Boy, two, and man, 41, killed as two others injured in Germany knife attack
1217.summary: A two-year-old boy and 41-year-old man have been killed while two others were injured in a stabbing incident in the southern German state of Bavaria.

1218.title: South Korea to remove airport concrete barriers after deadly crash
1218.summary: South Korea will remove concrete barriers used at airports across the country after a plane crash in December that claimed the lives of 179 people.

1219.title: Cat left on plane ends up taking three flights before reaching its destination
1219.summary: A family's move from New Zealand to Australia went horribly wrong when they realised their cat had been left on the plane and flown back home.

1220.title: Elephants can't pursue release because they are not people, court rules
1220.summary: A court has ruled that five elephants being held in a Colorado zoo do not have the legal right to pursue their release, because they are not human.

1221.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
1221.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
1221.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

1222.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
1222.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
1222.author: Seema Mehta

1223.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
1223.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington.
1223.author: Kevin Rector

1224.title: Immigrant rights advocates prepare to fight Trump's immigration orders
1224.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
1224.author: Andrea Castillo

1225.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
1225.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
1225.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

1226.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
1226.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
1226.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

1227.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
1227.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
1227.author: Robin Abcarian

1228.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
1228.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
1228.author: Kevin Rector

1229.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
1229.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
1229.author: Seema Mehta

1230.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
1230.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
1230.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

1231.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
1231.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
1231.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

1232.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
1232.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
1232.author: Lila Seidman

1233.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
1233.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
1233.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

1234.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
1234.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
1234.author: Doyle McManus

1235.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
1235.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
1235.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

1236.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
1236.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
1236.author: Kevin Rector

1237.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
1237.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
1237.author: Seema Mehta

1238.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
1238.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
1238.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

1239.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
1239.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
1239.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

1240.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
1240.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
1240.author: A.T. McWilliams

1241.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
1241.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
1241.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

1242.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
1242.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
1242.author: Karen Kaplan

1243.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
1243.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
1243.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

1244.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
1244.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
1244.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

1245.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
1245.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
1245.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

1246.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
1246.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
1246.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

1247.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
1247.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
1247.author: Doyle McManus

1248.title: Column: Why's it so hard to do the right thing and honor the true heroes of Jan. 6?
1248.summary: Nearly three years after passage of legislation to place a commemorative plaque on the western front of the Capitol there is still no action. Speaker Mike Johnson and other Trump allies are trying to bury history.
1248.author: Mark Z. Barabak

1249.title: Calmes: Biden delivered a new 'Roaring '20s.' Watch Trump try to take the credit
1249.summary: No matter what the new president says, the facts show that Joe Biden left America in better economic shape than he found it.
1249.author: Jackie Calmes

1250.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon storm courthouse. Some see hope in Trump's return
1250.summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's supporters storm the courthouse that issued a warrant extending his detention, climbing walls and smashing windows.
1250.author: Max Kim

1251.title: Trump expected to survey Los Angeles-area wildfire damage this week
1251.summary: President-elect Donald Trump, in perhaps his first official trip after being inaugurated Monday, will likely visit the Los Angeles area to survey wildfire damage late next week.
1251.author: Seema Mehta

1252.title: Supreme Court will decide if parents may reject LGBTQ+ lessons for their kids
1252.summary: Supreme Court will take up a dispute over grade school textbooks that include LGBTQ+ themes, pitting religious rights against individual rights.
1252.author: David G. Savage

1253.title: Brad Pitt's team reminds fans he's not on social media after a woman gets big-time scammed
1253.summary: Brad Pitt is not on social media, his team reminded fans, after a French woman said she was conned out of $800,000 by scammers posing as the A-list actor.
1253.author: Nardine Saad

1254.title: Supreme Court upholds law that could force TikTok to shut down in U.S.
1254.summary: Congress and now the Supreme Court say TikTok must separate itself from its Chinese owners or shut down operations in the U.S.
1254.author: David G. Savage

1255.title: Joan Plowright, award-winning 'Enchanted April' and 'Stalin' actor, dies at 95
1255.summary: Joan Plowright, the celebrated English actor whose career included the films 'Enchanted April,' 'The Entertainer' and 'Spiderwick Chronicles,' has died at 95.
1255.author: Alexandra Del Rosario

1256.title: Opinion: What a century-old disaster can teach fire-ravaged L.A. about recovery and rebuilding
1256.summary: Some in the fire-ravaged city have taken to laying personal blame. But what endures from the Canadian disaster is the generosity of those who helped rebuild.
1256.author: Ben Proudfoot

1257.title: Migration across the U.S.-Mexico border, in 5 charts
1257.summary: Arrivals at the border are the lowest they've been since incoming President Trump first left office in 2021.
1257.author: Andrea Castillo, Koko Nakajima

1258.title: Trump made many 'Day 1' promises. Will he make good on them?
1258.summary: President-elect Donald Trump could start taking action Monday on his many "Day 1" campaign promises, but California officials and others are ready to fight.
1258.author: Kevin Rector

1259.title: Bitter feud among Sinaloa cartel families brings grim new tactic: Grave desecration
1259.summary: In the escalating war among rival factions of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, sons of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán are suspected of ordering the destruction of elaborate mausoleums that belong to rival families, including one for a fallen grandson of Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada.
1259.author: Keegan Hamilton

1260.title: Fire lessons from the Australian capital, where a 2003 inferno changed everything
1260.summary: Two decades ago, fire ripped through Canberra, destroying 480 homes. An Australian fire chief reflects on possible lessons for California.
1260.author: Max Kim

1261.title: Padilla hopes to increase firefighter pay, create affordable housing for disaster response
1261.summary: California Sen. Alex Padilla introduced several bills to increase firefighter pay, expand FEMA funding and include affordable housing as part of disaster response.
1261.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

1262.title: Harris joins a decades-old tradition for vice presidents in her final days in office
1262.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, in one of her last public appearances in the role, signed her ceremonial desk drawer at the White House on Thursday, a tradition that dates back nearly a century.
1262.author: Seema Mehta

1263.title: Rep. Nancy Pelosi will not attend Trump's inauguration
1263.summary: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco) will not attend the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump.
1263.author: Kevin Rector

1264.title: Calmes: The case of the missing Hegseth investigation
1264.summary: Trump's unfit nominee for Defense secretary gets the benefit of an incomplete, half-baked and secret FBI report.
1264.author: Jackie Calmes

1265.title: What will Mexico do if Trump tries to mass deport non-Mexicans across the border?
1265.summary: How will Mexican leaders respond if, as expected, Trump pressures them to accept deportees from third countries? 'Mexico is in a really tough spot.'
1265.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

1266.title: Supreme Court leans in favor of state-enforced age limits on porn websites
1266.summary: Can Texas and other red states limit children from instant access to vast amounts of online pornography? The Supreme Court will decide.
1266.author: David G. Savage

1267.title: Neil Gaiman denies sexual assault allegations: 'I don't accept there was any abuse'
1267.summary: Neil Gaiman, the bestselling fantasy author, denies sexual abuse allegations made by eight women in an explosive New York Magazine article.
1267.author: Nardine Saad

1268.title: The FDA knew long ago that red dye No. 3 causes cancer. Why did it take so long to ban it?
1268.summary: The FDA banned the use of red dye No. 3 in foods and medicines sold in the U.S. because it has been shown to cause cancer in rats. The action highlights the limits of a federal law known as the Delaney clause.
1268.author: Karen Kaplan

1269.title: Sen. Marco Rubio appears set to win confirmation as secretary of State
1269.summary: Rubio and Trump have put aside past acrimony to make the Florida lawmaker the least controversial in an unusual slate of Cabinet picks.
1269.author: Tracy Wilkinson

1270.title: Cease-fire deal reached between Israel and Hamas in Gaza
1270.summary: A cease-fire deal, announced by U.S. and Qatari mediators, promises to end more than a year of conflict in Gaza Strip. Some Israeli hostages would be exchanged for Palestinian prisoners under the agreement.
1270.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King, Nabih Bulos

1271.title: Trump's tariffs brought China and Mexico closer. Will his second term change that?
1271.summary: China has strengthened trade with Latin America at the expense of the U.S. But Donald Trump, who threatens to raise tariffs on Mexico, could upend those ties.
1271.author: Stephanie Yang

1272.title: Biden administration to lift 'terrorism' designation on Cuba
1272.summary: In its waning days, the first Trump administration put Cuba on terrorism list. Biden is removing it.
1272.author: Tracy Wilkinson

1273.title: 'TikTok refugees' unexpectedly turn to Chinese alternative as ban looms
1273.summary: A number of TikTok users appear to be turning to an app called RedNote — more commonly known to its majority-Chinese audience by its Chinese name, Xiaohongshu.
1273.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

1274.title: The Senate is considering the Laken Riley Act. Here's what it would do
1274.summary: The bill would require immigration officers to detain immigrants who are suspected of minor theft and cede some federal immigration enforcement power to states.
1274.author: Andrea Castillo

1275.title: Kate Middleton's cancer is now in remission: 'It takes time to adjust to a new normal'
1275.summary: Catherine, Princess of Wales, confirmed Tuesday that her cancer is in remission during a visit with the staff and patients of the Royal Marsden in Chelsea.
1275.author: Nardine Saad

1276.title: Special counsel report says Trump would've been convicted for 'unprecedented criminal effort' in Jan. 6 case
1276.summary: The report, arriving just days before Trump is to return to office, focuses fresh attention on his failed effort to cling to power after his election loss in 2020.
1276.author: Alanna Durkin Richer, Eric Tucker and Colleen Long

1277.title: Supreme Court denies oil industry plea to block climate lawsuits filed by California, other blue states
1277.summary: Supreme Court will not block California's suit against big oil companies for damage from climate change.
1277.author: David G. Savage

1278.title: Column: Trump wants to grab control of Greenland, Canada and the Panama Canal. He's already bungled it
1278.summary: Trump wants to take Greenland from Denmark, make Canada the 51st state and retake the Panama Canal, threats reflecting his view that might makes right.
1278.author: Doyle McManus

1279.title: Newsom suspends landmark environmental laws to ease rebuilding in wildfire zones
1279.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom on Sunday signed an executive order suspending parts of the Coastal Act and the California Environmental Quality Act to aid homeowners rebuilding after losses in last week's wildfires.
1279.author: Seema Mehta, Liam Dillon, Rosanna Xia

1280.title: Calmes: Merrick Garland's integrity saved the DOJ only to doom it again
1280.summary: Atty. Gen. Merrick Garland's uprightness rescued the Department of Justice from Donald Trump's grip. But then he handed it over again.
1280.author: Jackie Calmes

1281.title: 'This is your Hurricane Katrina': Assessing the long road ahead for L.A.
1281.summary: Craig Fugate, who led the Federal Emergency Management Agency in the Obama administration, has seen a lot of natural disasters.
1281.author: Kevin Rector

1282.title: Opinion: Why Israel can't just 'cut the head off' of Hamas or Hezbollah
1282.summary: These groups are organic and homegrown, unlike the Islamic State or Al Qaeda, which have relied heavily on fighters from abroad. Hamas and Hezbollah will replenish their ranks with locals.
1282.author: Colin P. Clarke

1283.title: Column: 'Are you OK?' Thank you for asking about us in fire-ravaged L.A.
1283.summary: If you live in Southern California, you're getting the messages via text, email, IMs, chats and every other way imaginable: People worldwide asking if you are safe.
1283.author: Lorraine Ali

1284.title: 'They just got my uncle': Immigration arrests spark fear among farmworkers in Central Valley
1284.summary: Dozens have been arrested in the heavily agricultural Kern County during a multiple-day operation by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
1284.author: Rachel Uranga, Andrea Castillo

1285.title: 2024 was the hottest year on record, NASA and NOAA confirm
1285.summary: Weather organizations from around the world agree that the planet's average global surface temperature in 2024 could well have passed a crucial threshold meant to limit the worst effects of climate change.
1285.author: Corinne Purtill, Karen Kaplan

1286.title: Supreme Court casts doubt on TikTok's free-speech defense as shutdown law is set to take effect
1286.summary: Supreme Court is not likely to save TikTok from a U.S. shutdown, but incoming President Trump may try.
1286.author: David G. Savage, Andrea Chang

1287.title: South Korea's far right borrows from Trump's playbook to bolster impeached Yoon
1287.summary: The president's conservative supporters contend that the country has been overrun by North Korea sympathizers conspiring to destroy South Korea's freedoms.
1287.author: Max Kim

1288.title: Alec Baldwin sues New Mexico, claiming malicious prosecution
1288.summary: Six months after being cleared of criminal charges in the "Rust" shooting death, actor Alec Baldwin has filed a suit alleging malicious prosecution and defamation by New Mexico prosecutors and law enforcement.
1288.author: Meg James

1289.title: Supreme Court turns down Trump plea to block New York sentencing for hush money conviction
1289.summary: Trump and his lawyers saw Supreme Court as a friendly forum, but it turned down his request.
1289.author: David G. Savage

1290.title: News Analysis: Carter, during and after presidency, changed way world saw the U.S. — often for the better
1290.summary: He brought human rights to forefront in foreign policy, laid security foundations that have endured.
1290.author: Tracy Wilkinson

1291.title: Calmes: Jimmy Carter, Joe Biden and revisionist presidential history
1291.summary: Even Republicans, who have used President Carter to attack Democrats for nearly 50 years, have had to reckon with revisionism.
1291.author: Jackie Calmes

1292.title: Jimmy Carter and the sad saga of a 9-ton Northern California peanut
1292.summary: Former President Jimmy Carter once was offered a gift from Northern California: a 9-ton peanut carved from a redwood tree. His aides said no thanks.
1292.author: Hailey Branson-Potts

1293.title: Biden celebrates birth of great-grandchild after briefing on L.A. wildfires
1293.summary: President Biden announced that he became a great-grandfather on Wednesday after his granddaughter Naomi gave birth in Los Angeles.
1293.author: Liam Dillon

1294.title: A long, freezing wait for a few hushed moments: A people's farewell to Jimmy Carter
1294.summary: What people thought about at the public viewing of Jimmy Carter lying in state in the Capitol: reflections on a long and well-lived life, anxiety over what lies ahead.
1294.author: Laura King

1295.title: What's in a name? Gulf of America? Mexican America?
1295.summary: Mexico's president pokes fun at Trump's suggestion to change the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America.
1295.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

1296.title: Barbara Lee announces bid for Oakland mayor as city looks to rise from crisis
1296.summary: Former U.S. Rep. Barbara Lee, who represented the East Bay in Congress for over two decades, announced plans to run for mayor of Oakland in a special election.
1296.author: Hannah Wiley

1297.title: It was once the capital of Iran's 'axis of resistance.' Now a Syrian town grapples with its future
1297.summary: The Syrian shrine of Sayeda Zainab drew Iran-backed militiamen from throughout the region. With Assad's fall, they've fled, raising questions about the future of the area — and of the axis.
1297.author: Nabih Bulos

1298.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to block his sentencing in New York criminal case
1298.summary: Trump urges Supreme Court to intervene to stop his sentencing in New York for his hush money conviction.
1298.author: David G. Savage

1299.title: Bracing for Trump, Mexico aims to roll out a 'panic app' for Mexican nationals being deported
1299.summary: Bracing for Trump and his threatened migrant roundups, Mexico aims to roll out a 'panic app' for Mexican nationals facing deportation from the United States.
1299.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

1300.title: Opinion: The limits of an imperial presidency
1300.summary: Executive actions by presidents have to be grounded in defensible legal authority and process. Just because Donald Trump says he can do something doesn't mean he can.
1300.author: Stephen A. Myrow

1301.title: 'All hell will break out': 3 foreign policy takeaways from Trump
1301.summary: Trump promised 'all hell will break out' in the Middle East if Israeli hostages are not returned by the time he takes office.
1301.author: Faith E. Pinho, Patrick J. McDonnell, Tracy Wilkinson

1302.title: Opinion: Trump wants to rekindle his Kim Jong Un bromance, but North Korea has other suitors now
1302.summary: Trump's personal diplomacy couldn't solve the North Korean nuclear conundrum first time around. What are his chances now?
1302.author: Daniel R. DePetris

1303.title: Opinion: What antiabortion activists want next
1303.summary: The Supreme Court said states should decide access to abortion, but activists are mounting lawsuits and lobbying Washington for what could amount to a national ban.
1303.author: Mary Ziegler

1304.title: Strong earthquake in China kills scores of people in Tibet
1304.summary: The USGS measured the quake at 7.1. Dozens of aftershocks shook the region of western China and across the border in Nepal.
1304.author: Ken Moritsugu

1305.title: Paco Ignacio Taibo II: A book-reading advocate in the era of TikTok
1305.summary: The acclaimed novelist and historian runs Mexican government publishing house El Fondo de Cultura Económica.
1305.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

1306.title: Opinion: The election shredded the rule of law
1306.summary: Judge Juan M. Merchan has few alternatives but to hand President-elect Donald Trump a get-out-of-jail-free card.
1306.author: Erwin Chemerinsky

1307.title: Harris presides as Congress certifies Trump's victory, marking a very different Jan. 6
1307.summary: Four years after Donald Trump supporters stormed the Capitol, Vice President Kamala Harris formally certified his win in the 2024 election.
1307.author: Faith E. Pinho

1308.title: What a new study does — and doesn't — say about fluoride and its link to IQ
1308.summary: A new report that analyzes research on fluoride and IQ scores finds that the more fluoride a child is exposed to, the lower he or she tends to score on intelligence tests. The findings' relevance to the U.S. isn't clear.
1308.author: Karen Kaplan

1309.title: Column: Biden's legacy, like Jimmy Carter's, is complex — and it's in Donald Trump's hands now
1309.summary: Jimmy Carter showed that presidents seen as failures on leaving can be viewed generously years later. What about Biden? His legacy is in Trump's hands.
1309.author: Doyle McManus

1310.title: Orca who carried dead calf's body for weeks has lost another offspring
1310.summary: The calf was born in late December. Observing researchers noted unusual unspecified behaviors by mother and calf that led them to worry for the young whale's health.
1310.author: Corinne Purtill

1311.title: Driver of exploding Cybertruck left letters of anguish: 'I needed to cleanse my mind'
1311.summary: Writings by Matthew Livelsberger suggest the Green Beret was motivated partly by his experiences in combat when he killed himself in an exploding Cybertruck.
1311.author: Monte Morin

1312.title: Why the U.S. surgeon general wants cancer warning labels on alcoholic drinks
1312.summary: U.S. Surgeon General Vivek Murthy wants Americans to know that drinking is a preventable risk factor for cancer, and he issued an advisory that calls for warning labels to be placed on alcoholic beverages.
1312.author: Karen Kaplan, Melody Petersen

1313.title: Meet the 9 new House members from California
1313.summary: Veteran Reps. Pete Aguilar (D-Redlands) and Ted Lieu (D-Torrance) hold the positions of Democratic Caucus chair and vice chair, respectively.
1313.author: Faith E. Pinho

1314.title: After New Orleans attack by U.S. citizen, Trump rails against immigrants, 'open borders'
1314.summary: Though a U.S. citizen killed revelers on Bourbon Street, experts say the incoming president sees advantages in blaming immigrants and Islam for New Year's Day attack.
1314.author: James Rainey, Rachel Uranga

1315.title: Federal court decision won't change California net neutrality law
1315.summary: The 6th Circuit Court of Appeals blasted the FCC's attempts to regulate broadband internet, but state laws in California and New York remain intact.
1315.author: Meg James

1316.title: Opinion: Why Trump's plan to deport millions will fall far short of what it promises
1316.summary: Many of the immigrants removed from the United States inevitably come back, driven by connections here and risks in their countries of origin.
1316.author: Saúl Ramírez

1317.title: Tesla Cybertruck attacker in Las Vegas identified as decorated Green Beret: What was his motive?
1317.summary: Authorities have tentatively identified the man killed inside a Tesla Cybertruck outside the Trump hotel in Las Vegas as 37-year-old Matthew Livelsberger. Here's what we know.
1317.author: Summer Lin, Hannah Fry, Richard Winton, Terry Castleman

1318.title: FCC's net neutrality rules struck down, in another blow to Biden administration
1318.summary: A federal appeals court in Ohio ruled that the Federal Communications Commission lacked authority to reinstate open internet rules.
1318.author: Meg James

1319.title: Islamic State's brutal ideology still inspires attacks worldwide
1319.summary: At its height, the group controlled a huge swath of Mideast territory and ruled over millions. Today, its brutal ideology still powers offshoots and inspires "lone wolves."
1319.author: Nabih Bulos, Laura King

1320.title: New Orleans attacker acted alone; feds look for ties to Cybertruck explosion in Las Vegas
1320.summary: Federal officials say the New Orleans attacker acted alone, but are probing any links to the Cybertruck explosion in Las Vegas.
1320.author: Hannah Fry, Richard Winton, Summer Lin

1321.title: How long will Elon Musk last in Trump's good book after Vivek Ramaswamy's DOGE exit? 'Longer than many but...'
1321.summary: Vivek Ramaswamy is believed to have lost Donald Trump's favor, leaving Elon Musk as the main figure at the Department of Government Efficiency. Former Trump aide Anthony Scaramucci predicts that Musk, despite his wealth, won't last more than a year in Trump's circle. Infighting in the West Wing seems imminent, he said, while Ramaswamy focuses on the Ohio governor election.
1321.author: TOI World Desk

1322.title: Anthony Scaramucci mocks at Vivek Ramaswamy's DOGE exit, says he lasted 'minus one day'
1322.summary: “Ramaswamy lasted minus one day, OK? He got blown out on Jan. 19, so he’s not even—you can’t even measure him by Scaramuccis, which are 11-day time units," Anthony Sacaramucci said. Scaramucci was fired by Trump as White House director after a week and a half but Scaramucci used that fame to appear on media regularly and then he created a super PAC that supported Joe Biden in 2020.
1322.author: TOI World Desk

1323.title: Antioch High School shooting: Student opens fire on two pupils, then turns gun to himself
1323.summary: ​A student shot two other pupils in a Tennesse high school cafeteria shootout before turning the gun to himself inside the cafeteria. Antioch High School where the incident took place was immediately placed on lockdown because of the sudden shooting. The Tennessee Bureau of Investigation, Tennessee Highway Patrol, Tennessee Homeland Security and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives have said they also are responding.
1323.author: TOI World Desk

1324.title: Sam Altman snubs Elon Musk, calls him wrong: Why two tech bros are fighting over Stargate
1324.summary: Elon Musk and Sam Altman publicly clashed over Donald Trump's $500 billion AI project, with Musk claiming in the public that OpenAI and SoftBank don't have that much money. "Wrong, as you surely know. Want to come visit the first site already under way? This is great for the country. I realize what is great for the country isn't always what's optimal for your companies, but in your new role I hope you'll mostly put America first," Sam Altman said.
1324.author: TOI World Desk

1325.title: Beirut Airport receives 23rd relief plane carrying 35 tonnes of medical supplies as part of 'UAE stands with Lebanon'
1325.summary: The UAE has sent its 23rd relief plane to Lebanon as part of the "UAE stands with Lebanon" campaign, delivering 35 tonnes of medical supplies, including essential devices and equipment for hospitals. This continued support, initiated by President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed, aims to alleviate Lebanon's healthcare and economic crises. The UAE remains committed to providing aid to Lebanon and other nations facing crises.

1326.title: 'Dear President Trump...': Contents of Joe Biden's letter to Trump revealed
1326.summary: As Donald Trump revealed the contents of the letter left by Joe Biden, he said it was a very nice letter. "It was a little bit of an inspirational-type letter. Enjoy it, do a good job. Important, very important. How important the job is," Trump said about the letter. "It was a positive, for him, in writing it," Trump continued. "I appreciated the letter."
1326.author: TOI World Desk

1327.title: Scholz asks why Afghan knife attack suspect was still in Germany
1327.summary: German chancellor Olaf Scholz condemned a deadly knife attack Wednesday as "an unbelievable act of terror" and demanded to know why the Afghan suspect had been able to stay in the country. Scholz, who faces elections a month from now, called the attack "an unbelievable act of terror" and offered his sympathies to the victims' families and two more people injured.

1328.title: Hamas back on Gaza streets after war with Israel
1328.summary: After more than a year hiding in tunnels and dodging air strikes, uniformed Hamas fighters returned to the ruined streets of Gaza hours into a ceasefire, defying Israel's vow to crush them. - 'Game of whack-a-mole' - The ceasefire is in its infancy and many questions remain about the future of the Gaza Strip and Hamas.

1329.title: Bishop Mariann Budde says Trump politicized her 'have mercy' speech: 'I was just trying to...'
1329.summary: ​Reacting to the controversy, the bishop said her message was politicized but it was kind of a given that her message would be politicized, she said. "I think if you read what I said, I mean how could it not be politicized, right? We are in a hyper-political climate. ​One of the things I caution about is the culture of contempt in which we live that immediately rushes to the worst possible interpretations of what people are saying and to put them in categories. That's part of the air we breathe now," the bishop said.
1329.author: TOI World Desk

1330.title: A rebel group is advancing on eastern Congo's largest city and over 100,000 people have fled
1330.summary: The M23 rebel group’s advance toward Goma in eastern Congo has displaced over 178,000 people in two weeks, exacerbating the region’s ongoing humanitarian crisis. The rebels captured key towns, including Minova, and continue to threaten Goma. Rwanda is accused of supporting M23, though it denies the claim. Thousands of displaced people are fleeing to camps, facing ongoing violence and uncertainty.

1331.title: 'Trump 2.0 prioritising US-India ties': Jaishankar after Quad meet
1331.author: TOI News Desk

1332.title: Former El Salvador President Mauricio Funes dies in exile in Nicaragua at age 65
1332.summary: Mauricio Funes, former President of El Salvador (2009-2014), died at 65 in Nicaragua, where he had sought refuge to avoid corruption charges. Funes faced multiple convictions related to corruption and gang deals but never served prison time. He denied the charges, calling them political persecution. His death leaves a complex and controversial legacy.

1333.title: US Capitol Riots timeline: What actually happened on January 6, 2021
1333.summary: Donald Trump granted clemency to over 1,500 individuals related to the January 6 Capitol riots, including violent offenders. On that day, rioters stormed the Capitol to halt the certification of Biden’s victory, resulting in injuries and deaths. Trump’s speeches incited the mob, leading to chaos and multiple instances of violence and destruction.

1336.title: Donald Trump administration halts travel plans, flights for refugees cleared to resettle in the US
1336.summary: The Trump administration canceled plans for 10,000 refugees, who had completed a years-long vetting process, to resettle in the US. The cancellations, stemming from President Trump's executive order, affect medical exams, security clearances, and freeze the US refugee program. Special Immigrant Visa holders are exempt from this order.
1336.author: TOI World Desk

1337.title: Kamala Harris considers husband Doug Emhoff as 'dead weight', has already taken up job in New York: Report

1338.title: 'We can do it the easy way, or the hard way': Trump's ultimatum to Putin on Russia-Ukraine war
1338.summary: US President Donald Trump suggests more sanctions on Russia if President Vladimir Putin does not engage in negotiating an end to the Ukraine war. Trump emphasizes the dire consequences for Russia if it continues. Putin indicates readiness for dialogue, aiming for a sustainable resolution while prioritizing Russian interests.
1338.author: TOI World Desk

1339.title: Former UK PM Rishi Sunak takes up posts at Oxford, Stanford universities
1339.summary: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has taken on academic roles at the University of Oxford and Stanford University. He joined Oxford’s Blavatnik School of Government as a distinguished fellow and member of the world leaders circle, while at Stanford, he became a visiting fellow at the Hoover Institution, focusing on global security, economic policy, and technology. Sunak expressed excitement to contribute to research and policy on both sides of the Atlantic.

1340.title: Trump stings MAGA by again supporting H-1B
1340.summary: US President Donald Trump advocated for expanding the H1B visa program to include top global talent in non-STEM areas, such as high-quality waiters and wine experts. 1561.title: Fallen Black South African Soldiers From World War I Finally Remembered
1561.summary:
CAPE TOWN, Jan 22 (IPS) - A new war memorial in Cape Town, South Africa, remembers the close to 2,000 casualties who served in Africa during World War 1, between 1914-1918 and who have no known graves and because they were Black, they were never remembered in the official narratives of history.It was a solemn ceremony on a bright sunny day on the southern tip of Africa, in Cape Town’s company gardens, amid the grass wooden structures that stand out. The 1,700 carefully constructed brown wooden carvings are standing in a line. These structures represent a new Commonwealth War Graves Commission (CWGC) memorial, which honors the contribution of the hundreds of Black South African military laborers of the First World War. The CWGC remembers the fallen soldiers of both World Wars equally with this first permanent redress tribute.

Read the full story, “Fallen Black South African Soldiers From World War I Finally Remembered”, on globalissues.org →

1565.title: The First Phase of Israel-Palestine Ceasefire Begins

UNITED NATIONS, Jan 21 (IPS) - On January 15, 2025, the long-awaited ceasefire proposal between Israel and Hamas was approved, bringing the first bout of relief for the people of the Gaza Strip after 15 months of conflict. This has allowed for the exchange of prisoners and hostages between the two nations as well as a greater flow of humanitarian aid to be directed to Gaza. Although this only accounts for the first phase out of the three phase plan, it is uncertain if Israel will continue to uphold the negotiations of a truce after the first phase is completed.

1569.title: What is the World Health Organization and why does it matter?
1569.summary:
When the plague, cholera and yellow fever rippled deadly waves across a newly industrialised and interconnected world in the mid-19th century, taking a global approach to health became an imperative. Doctors, scientists, presidents and prime ministers urgently convened the International Sanitary Conference in Paris in 1851, a precursor to what is now the largest of its kind: the World Health Organization, known as WHO.

Read the full story, “What is the World Health Organization and why does it matter?”, on globalissues.org →
